name: "Mario Party 9" Quiz / Test | Mario Party | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many minigames are in the game?
questions.explanation:
Eighty.

	They are new minigames. Some are related to other ones, but not all of them are related.

questions.text: Does the game need the Nunchuk?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The game doesn't need any extra accessories. The game is simple to play because of this.

questions.text: Who is the host of the game?
questions.explanation:
Toad.

	There is also a different Toad you can play with. Toad can help you when needed.

questions.text: What is the maximum number of people that can play the game?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	1 to 4 people can play. Any extra players are filled in with computer players.

questions.text: How many types of minigames are there?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	The types are 4 player, Boss Battle, 1 vs. Rivals, and Bowser Jr. There are varying amounts of games in each category.

questions.text: How many modes are in the game?
questions.explanation:
Five.

	The modes are Party, Minigames, Solo, Extras, and Museum. All of them except Solo offer more than one mode.

questions.text: What do you want to collect in Party and Solo modes?
questions.explanation:
Mini Stars.

	The more Mini Stars you have, the higher chance there is for you to win. They are white, so you'll know what they look like.

questions.text: How many modes are there in Minigame mode?
questions.explanation:
Seven.

	They include Free Play, Time Attack, Boss Battle, Choice Challenge, and Step it Up. Boss Battle isn't available right away, but the other ones are.

questions.text: What do you want to avoid when playing Solo or Party?
questions.explanation:
Mini Ztars.

	Mini Ztars take Mini Stars away from your total. The less you collect, the better off you'll be.

questions.text: How many Mini Stars are awarded for each Bonus Star?
questions.explanation:
Five.

	You can get up to 15 Mini Stars because 3 out of 6 possible criteria are met. The Mini Stars are given out to the who fulfils the most criteria the game wants.
